intro: Sudamerlycaste × tornemezae, commonly known as the hybrid evergreen shrub, is a botanical curiosity resulting from the cross between two species of the Lychnis genus. It exhibits characteristics of both parent plants, showcasing a mix of foliage and floral traits. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun exposure. Its flowers, which are usually pink or red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its unique genetic makeup, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and botanical collections.
